intro: Senecio cuchumatanensis, commonly known as the Cuchumatán groundsel, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in temperate to cool climates. Its leaves are usually narrow and slightly hairy, while its flowers are yellow with a central disc. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
